title: Guarding Coherence

panel_structure.description: The Architect delicately pulling petals from a flower, each petal representing a borrowed piece of identity falling away
What remains after petals fall—not emptiness but a coherent center, a working model that functions regardless of borrowed parts

transformation_notes: The flower metaphor shows that stripping away borrowed pieces doesn't destroy the self—what matters is the coherent center that makes everything work together.
